The idea is to build a platform that makes it easier to manage and collaborate on Excel spreadsheets, which would be useful for people working on projects with a lot of data that they need to send around.

In terms of what these startups are trying to accomplish, they all have slightly different goals, but they are all trying to solve the same problem. What they have in common is they are building solutions that are focused around simplifying the experience of managing data, both of the data and the tools used to manage it.

The world of finance is changing dramatically, and there‚Äôs a lot of confusion around how new technologies like fintech will impact financial services. Fintech can take the form of apps, startups, and platforms, or it can be composed of a mix of all three. Fintech is a catch-all term that can include everything from cryptocurrencies, to artificial intelligence, to machine learning, and more. Fintech startup solutions help companies navigate these changes.

Upstart Energy is building a solar plant in the desert of California to compete with utility companies that have built nuclear plants. The startup aims to use an asset-light model and build a plant for around $1.5 billion.

A person can‚Äôt buy domain names any more. So instead they can go to a URL registrar like GoDaddy and buy a name pair like ‚Äúwww.airlines.com‚Äù. The startup is taking names in the .com, .net, .org, .us and .gov TLDs and buying them up in bulk with the idea that it can then resell them at a premium.

A messaging system for restaurants that allows hosts to manage reservations, ticket sales, and reservations.

A company that maps and tracks all your trips.

A startup that helps SMBs (small to medium sized businesses) through their supply chain by tracking products, manufacturing, and shipping.

This startup is building a tool that lets a user take photos, add lines, and then a designer can come in and polish the design.

A payroll company that wants to ‚Äúmake payroll simple‚Äù.

A way to easily translate whole works into different languages, allowing for more sharing and easier access.

A company that provides automated systems to finance investors in startups

‚ÄúA startup for the exchange of surplus data between companies, where data producers can sell their data to the highest bidder.‚Äù

A software platform that allows small businesses to create branded chatbots. It‚Äôs an ‚Äúapp store for apps‚Äù that allows small businesses to create chatbots.

A startup that wants to sell high-end football jerseys for the NFL.

A platform for early stage companies that focuses on the content side of an entrepreneur‚Äôs portfolio

A text-to-speech service for the blind that uses the Amazon Echo to convert written words to audio. WordBlind uses a technology called "on-the-fly" speech synthesis to convert text to audio that sounds like the original.

This B2B startup is building a platform to make it easier for companies to collaborate with each other. It uses a cloud-based software that lets companies share data with each other.

The startup is building an on-demand remote delivery service for restaurant takeout and delivery orders.

A comprehensive technology solution that supports the delivery of video content, from broadcast to pre-recorded video to live event video. The startup provides production services, and is another YC alum.

Very interested to see what comes of this product - the idea is to give you a way to create a smart contract with a shipping company that automatically tracks your package from the time it is picked up to the time it is delivered.

A startup that helps chefs to manage the back-end of food delivery, including online ordering, inventory management and delivery scheduling.

A startup that helps people to design, build and test their prototypes online Users will be able to share their prototypes with friends or partners

A place to buy and sell unused books.

A startup that‚Äôs building virtual reality that encourages mindfulness.

A company that recently launched in India is building a platform to help medical practices connect with patients, and is aiming to move into the US next.

A startup that aims to build a database of every person in American history, a database that would someday have a search engine that could find out, for example, where a person‚Äôs great-great-great-great-grandfather was born.

A tool for sharing your portfolio of creative work with the world

The startup has built an app that uses the same camera and lighting effects found in Hollywood movies to make a video look like it was shot by a camera crew. The startup aims to make it easier for filmmakers to add these effects to their own footage.

A company that helps people organize the lessons they learn in the classroom.

GZ delivers gadgets, such as a $300 Apple TV, to customers‚Äô homes and charges a convenience fee for delivery, which is cheaper than going to a brick-and-mortar store.

The BLS blog provides a daily newsletter, typically written by an economist, that summarizes recent changes in labor market conditions locally and nationally, and features summaries of research findings.

This startup is working on a toolkit for companies to build their own chatbots.

A software tool that helps companies manage expenses, track their spending, and make more money. The startup is looking to work with large corporations.

After launching in March, the startup has already signed up 7,000 customers (from only 5,000 in the past month). A customer can top up a phone to 100% in just a few minutes. The company charges 50 cents a day and $1 a month for unlimited recharges.

A platform that lets people take screenshots from their computer and quickly upload them to Slack.

An enterprise software platform that allows companies to aggregate their employee vacation and sick days into a single view, allowing them to put employees on leave at a moment‚Äôs notice.

A tool that helps contractors bid on jobs

This startup is building a social network for people in the legal industry. Its platform provides law firms with a way to communicate with clients and other law firms, as well as a way for clients to communicate with law firms about their cases.

A tool for managing the personas a company creates, the people that the brand is meant to appeal to, and how that audience interacts with the brand.

A company that helps people find the right healthcare provider when they need it, whether that's a doctor or a lab. Their product is a directory of doctors and their practices, with the ability to add doctors, review and edit information, and even schedule appointments.

A startup that allows brands to send weather reports to retailers for them to better plan their businesses.

A startup that‚Äôs building a service that allows employees to be paid without being on the payroll.

A way for people to search for parking spots and valet services with an app.

A startup that helps you track and locate your pet and provides a platform for fostering and adopting dogs and cats.

Firms can collect data on their customers and then have that data sent to the cloud and analyzed for insights. The company currently has the same set-up as a consulting firm before being purchased by a larger firm.

An intuitive, desktop-based app that allows a restaurant to manage their menu items and ingredients. The startup gets data from local grocery stores, which it then uses to create an automated interface where a person can have a single, intuitive experience to search for a new dish at a restaurant using their phone.

A tool for building interactive maps, allowing users to organize things like sports teams, book clubs, and other social groups.

The company has over 100,000 users who are saving over $100,000 every year.

It‚Äôs a ‚Äúfree radical‚Äù, a company in San Francisco, California, that wants to change the way the world thinks about health. It has a commercial in production with a director who‚Äôs won a couple of Oscars, and a book in development.

Metronome is a plugin for Spotify that helps you navigate playlists better by highlighting the songs you haven‚Äôt heard yet.

The system would integrate with school districts‚Äô existing timekeeping systems and calendars, so that students can be allotted days off throughout the summer to spend with their families or with internships or jobs.

A hardware company that wants to build a hardware-based receipt printer that can produce receipts on demand. The company wants to use the same materials as the paper industry, which is more sustainable than inkjet.

Many startups on the list came from India, a country that has been a "fintech powerhouse" in recent years. The country has a large population of engineers and a growing consumer base, and the availability of capital and technology has led to a boom in the number of startups in the country.

They‚Äôre focused on helping B2B companies improve their sales and marketing, and currently have clients in the financial services space.

This company builds apps for the Lockbox app, a lockbox service that lets people store valuables in a secure location.

A startup that helps people sell or donate their old phones to help fund their next phone. The company says that 80% of cell phones on the market are still in use, and that used phones are worth about $20 in the US. The startup connects with consumers on their cell phone, and ships them cash or an Amazon gift card to use.

A digital fermentation starter kit, which allows users to test the effectiveness of their recipes before they make the leap to a commercial scale. The startup makes it so that anyone with a smart phone can take a picture of a recipe and instantly begin the fermentation process, allowing them to get the same results from their recipes without having to buy expensive equipment or deal with the hassle of an expensive commercial scale.

This pair of Latinx entrepreneurs wants to use data and analytics to help people who‚Äôve been affected by incarceration make a successful transition back into society.

Insight is a ‚Äúsocially conscious marketplace‚Äù, with the goal of connecting people to good causes. Platforms include an online donation service, a marketplace where people can buy and sell things that help a cause, and a marketplace where people can communicate with the causes they support.

In the summer of 2016, Y Combinator opened a office in London to focus on Europe. The office is headed by Laura Simpson, who previously worked at eBay, and has joined the Y Combinator London team. Y Combinator London is focused on advising and investing in European startups and is led by Stephen O‚ÄôGrady, who previously worked at Twitter, Google, and Yahoo.

Focused on improving the user experience of people who travel internationally. The company brings together a private messaging platform for travelers with a photo-sharing feature. The company is in the testing phase and will be available in the U.S. and Europe.

With this company‚Äôs ‚Äúsocially intelligent‚Äù inventory management system, manufacturers can better predict demand for their products in real time, and thus lower their costs. It integrates with factories‚Äô inventory systems and takes orders and shipment predictions from social networks to figure out where to place a product‚Äôs next shipment.

They have a custom loyalty card that helps users identify the problem they want to solve, then build a purchase workflow. A content management system for fashion brands. The startup says it can help fashion brands stand out by making their online content more interactive and engaging.

A startup that makes custom-made, 3D-printed female prosthetics that can be used to treat urinary incontinence in women.

Booking.com has 50 million customers, but they still have to manually approve bookings. The startup wants to build a system that automatically approves bookings for hotels, without human intervention.

Cordyceps is a startup that helps you book medical appointments based on availability and location. The app can be used to book appointments, but it can also help you find an appointment for a dentist or other medical professional based on availability and location.

Idea: A tool for helping people improve their sleep. The startup provides a mattress with embedded sensors that can track movement and sound, letting users track data about their sleep.

A real estate agency software that helps agents close deals.

A startup in the travel industry that offers a new way to book hotels through a single app. The company, which was founded in May, is now live in over 40 cities and has over 4,000 hotel rooms booked.

A software company that helps companies with their legal process, from contract negotiation to hiring a lawyer for their legal needs.

A company that claims to have the world‚Äôs smallest solar power system. It‚Äôs for homes, but can be used anywhere.

If you own a home in the US, you can log into an app and see what the utilities are costing you in real time. However, the founders say that households throughout the world can benefit from a similar application.

A startup that connects consumers and brands to help them buy products online. The founder is a former Google engineer who was a co-founder of Instacart, a grocery delivery service, before launching this startup.

This company is in beta with a proof-of-concept product they built to make it easier for people to sign up for a newsletter. The startup offers free accounts, and then charges a small fee to advertisers.

The program is designed to provide baristas with the skills they need to run their own business, and to help them start their own locations.

The founders say they‚Äôve launched a beta version of the platform that lets parents order and schedule activities, and set rules around cancelling and rescheduling. The founders also have a personal story about how their startup led them to discover their company‚Äôs mission.

"Idea" is a weekly feature on The Verge's technology podcast, The Vergecast. Every week, we ask a question about a company or a topic at the intersection of technology and culture. You can listen to previous episodes here . You can read more about the show at our dedicated hub . You can reach us at ideas@theverge.com

A software platform that allows companies to manage their energy consumption and reduce energy bills. The company says it has $5.5M in seed funding, with a $1M Series A round in the works.

A startup that connects people who want to host an event with people who want to host an event. The startup has a staff of 20 and is based in San Francisco.

A visual search engine for photos. The startup is trying to build a search engine that boils down huge amounts of data into a vector-based visualization that can be manipulated with a computer.

This company is building an artificial intelligence engine that can build 3D models of anything in real time.

The company says it will be the first to offer a business development platform with the ability to serve the two different markets in India, B2B and B2C.

A startup that is building an AI assistant for home assistants, helping them take care of daily tasks for their users. The startup was founded in May and is looking to raise $1MM.

A dead simple, easy to use app that lets users track and manage their expenses. It helps users keep track of spending and stay within their allowances.

A startup for watching sports and other live events, with a focus on baseball. For example, MLB.TV provides you with access to the home team's uniform and logo, game schedules, and game stats.

This startup is building a real-time travel app that uses the GPS on your phone to help you navigate to your next destination.

A smart device that can monitor sleep cycles and ease the process of getting a better night's sleep. The startup is building out a smart device to help people sleep better.

A company that allows people to find and rent out their unused furniture and appliances. The startup wants to upend the industry by offering a way to sell the stuff you own while making money on the stuff you don't.

Wrapping up our list of the best startups in Y Combinator‚Äôs class of 2020, we've selected 5 startups from the batch that had the best business ideas and the best execution. (If you're curious, we'd recommend checking out the list of the top Y Combinator startups of 2019 here .)

A startup that has built an app for companies to manage remote workers. It works as a virtual call center. The client can choose to pay the workers via a direct deposit or via their bank account. The startup says that their product is like a landline, meaning that a worker can use it even if their employer doesn‚Äôt pay for the service.

An AI-based matchmaking system that pairs job seekers with employers.

Startups that fit into multiple categories, where founders have multiple roles ‚Äî co-founder, CEO, CTO and CIO, or just the founder and CTO ‚Äî are a bit more common today, but still rare. The challenge is that it can be difficult to measure how much of the company‚Äôs sales and profit go to the founder. Here‚Äôs a partial list of startups that fit into that category:

Great for users who want to maintain a network of family and friends, this startup is trying to build a system that analyzes text messages and sends push-notifications when your friends are nearby. The startup is in the early stages of development, but their team has already been working on the product for a year.

A company that helps small businesses build an online presence. They‚Äôre already working with a few small businesses who want to launch an online presence.

A social network for the furry community, owned by the same company as Fur Affinity.

A dating app for people who want to have casual sex, focused on avoiding pressure from other users. The app is meant to be a safe place for people who want to do something that‚Äôs not going to last.

With the app and website, users can select a package that fits their needs and then buy the package by clicking a button and the platform will automatically calculate the total cost for them.

Founded by two former Googlers in 2012, Giphy is a video search engine that helps users find content to animate GIFs from online videos.

A software company that helps companies manage their finance, inventory, and other business operations. The startup plans to open up to new markets and get into more verticals in 2018.

A new way to pay for things you buy online, with a twist: You can get discounts for paying with a certain amount of money.

A crowdfunding platform for people who have been denied loans from banks.

A company that makes reusable plastic shopping bags that are 100% compostable.

It‚Äôs a mobile app that helps people with their workouts, tracking their progress and helping them set plans and goals.

A tool for entrepreneurs to manage all of the legal, sales, and accounting documents for their company.

A digital tool that helps retailers navigate the price-off-requesting supply chain of their product.

This startup is building a toolset that helps cities and counties track and manage construction projects.

Web-based software that gives restaurants a way to track guests from table to table, and find out how much money they spend.
